page.title: 14DART VALLEY LIGHT RAILWAY
page.content: We went to the{DART VALLEY RAILWAY {COMPANY}and we spoke to one of the men in the office. He told us about{MR {BEECHING}who axed the branch line between{ASHBURTON }and{TOTNES. BRITISH {RAIL}did away with passenger transport in{1958}and goods in{1962.}In {1964-65 {DART VALLEY RAILWAY COMPANY}bought the line from{BRITISH RAIL}In 1984 the company had the biggest profits and are doing well. In 1969 the private line was opened and has been running for 16 years.In 1985 the railway had access for passengers to get off at Totnes.They have four engines and two diesels.The oldest engine is nearly {100 years}old.It doesn't work and is now in the museum.Each engine uses three quarters of a ton of coal and {5-600}gallons of water a day.
